43B6F504562A45CD947A45F896057C4C.description: Trace the development of African American culture in non-slave states and in the context of slavery.

3748AA4DE6404F10974225D0A182AB81.description: Analyze the evolution of the Abolitionist Movement to trace its continued development and evaluate its impact.

39AC74CA83FC43ECA6DF2502248C4A48.description: Analyze the evolution of the women’s movement to trace its continued development and evaluate its impact.

98B76B4885E34FF884D38494CDB8CE3C.description: Describe the impact of scientific and technological advances on the outcome of the war and its effect on people and diverse groups

61D7F810A6AB4A269CB59A1455B3FCDB.description: Determine the impact of the ideas contained in major speeches, literature, music, and writings from diverse individuals on the varying perspectives of American people, groups and movements.

B4DD9525E6D0492794C8919D6A85F54B.description: Compare the economic strengths and weaknesses of the North and South before, during and immediately after the Civil War.

B43CC9C0D60E4F73AECB4D658B59428B.description: Explain how the expansion of industrialization, transportation, and technological developments influenced different regions and the relationship among those regions.

376CFB01DC8D40E5A850AE33CD0E7628.description: Compare major patterns of population distribution, demographics and migrations in the United States and the impact of those patterns on cultures and community life in this time period.

9317AB4C9C644219A079ABDA3619E1D6.description: Evaluate the significance of geography on the conduct of the war and strategy of the North and South.

2E3D55C3041040D1B64AE339300F7FD9.description: Analyze the U.S. geography of North, South, and West in order to explain regional cultural, social and economic differences.

32EBF4C83462447BA493E647B3F1BD7E.description: Compare and contrast the governmental systems of the U.S. North and South to determine the strengths and weaknesses of federal and confederal systems.

B770E51DC8B1458C9578EB3FB3C63C8D.description: Analyze the election of 1860 to explain the development of political parties and how they influence the selection of leaders.

355A9699819C4577BA2CDF9B02940D85.description: Analyze federalism and popular sovereignty to explain peoples’ expectations of the role of government and their place in governance.

F244EFE1DF464FE4B7747C0CA03BB890.description: Compare responses of government systems in the North and South to major legislation, executive orders, and court decisions before, during and immediately after the Civil War.

33835B41AF0049AB9C82797E03DAD717.description: Describe critical developments and turning points in the Civil War, including major battles.

926712D28E264958875D1235C7017446.description: Trace the events as well as political, cultural, economic and social conditions leading to conflict between Northern and Southern states.

1B0074D20EED4965B21C10D4C0AFEDC7.description: Analyze political compromises over slavery in the territories to explain intensifying sectional conflicts.

55FD7FC1556847FBBFABA0161E6644F0.description: Analyze patterns of immigration to determine their impacts on the cultural, social, political and economic development of the United States.

1AF5B9283D8C43E680A95144F17388FF.description: Describe the culture and accomplishments of native Americans and African Americans in the ways they responded to American expansion.

DD34C53328374C1D8CE68CFBBAEA251C.description: Analyze diverse artistic, intellectual, and religious. movements to show how they reflect the aspirations and beliefs of the developing nation.

EF920BB9D94842CD8B65BAC866EBC76C.description: Analyze the experiences of enslaved peoples in North and South America to determine their cultural impact and enduring consequences.

498ACC6BF3DB4CBA9EDE8290E6B51988.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of various. reform movements, laws, and events to determine their impact on the promise of American ideals.

CAEB483D198E426486DBCD8C606581E5.description: Trace the continued development of the American economic system to explain how taxes, tariffs, and monetary policies were used to establish sustainability and growth.

D9BFFFD6E0214525AE69941A2B3E2ECF.description: Explain how the expansion of industrialization, transportation and technological developments influenced different regions and the relationship among those regions.

42A654AA7D7D40A5A1D56F367642DEAB.description: Analyze the origins and characteristics of coercive labor systems, including slavery, and their impact on economic and political expansion.

8C858AA8F2C44B51A3A074ABE793BF4B.description: Compare major patterns of population distribution, demographics and migrations in the United States and the impact of those patterns on cultures and community life in this time period.

2785ED8D46AF409691AC2076970320EC.description: Assess Manifest Destiny in relation to push-pull factors, geographic features, and human environmental interactions to determine their influence on the movement of goods, people and ideas.

959D388EEA0448EF81B2127A2292F739.description: Trace the changing boundaries of the United States and describe how it represents the changing relationships with its neighbors and Native Americans.

29F0B893BA1C4C0F9D467535AE2C91F2.description: Explain how the principles of rule of law, separation of powers, checks and balances, and federalism were impacted by Jacksonian Democracy.

7B9F0D8555684763B1EE10CCB19BF616.description: Analyze landmark Supreme Court cases to determine the effect on the definition and expansion of federal power.

78ECBBAD618F474F8A25E1621ACCEC81.description: Trace the expansion of voting rights and patterns and explain how it impacted elections and political movements.

900C2F0154B14F5E9FE27EDA63C13012.description: Analyze the forced removal and resettlements of Native Americans to determine its impact on their cultures and civilizations.

667062B5CC054D4CB2390F62077E0050.description: Evaluate the responses of North and South American leaders to the social, political, economic and religious. challenges of the period.

63811A79397646CABF3C6FCACF38E295.description: Analyze the expansion of the United States in the early nineteenth century to trace U.S. growth and form hypotheses about future conflicts.

AA8BD154E129443F8F85F72E211605A4.description: Analyze the artistic and intellectual achievements of early Americans to provide evidence of an emerging American identity.

D3D772AE8813421B970C3E2E9E602760.description: Evaluate laws, events, and perspectives to determine the extent to which individuals and groups could participate in, and realize, the promise of American ideals.

CB2F8ABAE1E946D8B02C7E77D60EC564.description: Compare and contrast the perspectives of individuals and groups regarding the development of the American governmental system to explain emerging divisions and political philosophies.

AAD561A243764D5C8947CBBA59DD7013.description: Analyze populations of colonies/states to explain how their cultural, religious, social, and economic characteristics influenced the emergence of regional identity.

7A160A819A044376B868FCE17B1EB2ED.description: Analyze the perspectives of diverse individuals and groups to explain the extent of their support for the Revolutionary War.

871538F1965845AC809BC54A9363F962.description: Trace the development of the American economic system to explain how taxes, tariffs, and monetary policies were used to establish sustainability and growth.

D23BBD0680534D3DA462457040259873.description: Compare the emerging economic characteristics of the nation and colonial regions to make predictions about future expansion and conflict.

6FEFEEF8654F41E982DEF31ACACF8350.description: Describe the function and purpose of taxes imposed by Great Britain following the Seven Years War, evaluating colonial responses to them.

7C00866AC0FB478BB079745D5E81A1B9.description: Compare major patterns of population distribution, demographics and migrations in the United States during this era c. 1763-1812.

21B12A935BF449258B463FBC2DFB7C4D.description: Evaluate the relationships among population, representation, and their effect on power in the new government.

07DDA3AA8A1C49AB9B26257FE32A0985.description: Draw conclusions about regional conflict and cooperation as a consequence of physical geography.

3FA4B266E75B4341B25B6AEC02CF0E30.description: Examine elections, issues, laws, and events of this time period to explain how the concepts of judicial review, elastic clause, and an amendment process were established or used to meet challenges.

FEE558A2A2C44D0187ABA1B9452361B7.description: Describe the origins and purposes of the Bill of Rights and evaluate the enduring significance of these concepts to the preservation of individual rights and liberties.

BAF88C18ADEA43298A0446267A92DBAA.description: Apply the principles of rule of law, representation, separation of powers, checks and balances, and federalism to explain the purposes and functions of the Constitution.

AAAA2C3B78C34443AB746389866B3E44.description: Evaluate the successes and challenges of the Articles of Confederation to explain the need for a Constitutional Convention.

3ECEA25A402744DDA1FC8BCEA1A3EF9E.description: Apply the principles of inalienable rights, popular sovereignty, natural rights, and social contract to evaluate the purpose and legacy of the Declaration of Independence.

E7CFCE1C9E6347AF88FF1AF966FA1126.description: Apply the concept of representation to the conflict between the colonies and Great Britain.

BA619592A6684658B61E6AF01B15C60C.description: Evaluate the impact of the French and Indian Wars on Great Britain’s approach to colonial rule.

BE4ECF15F743414F8FCF0B7DB52D381F.description: Infer how events of this period led to the development of philosophies, interest groups and political parties.

0212B3FD5D8E4B999C524DBE149C27AB.description: Evaluate the responses of early American leaders to the social, political, economic and religious. challenges facing the new nation.

D5046160BE824549B46E886AD7FF949D.description: Explain the major debates that occurred during the adoption of the Constitution and their ultimate resolution.

BCE8700CF95E4AE6BA19CF30FC48C9D2.description: Evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of the American colonies and Great Britain to explain the American victory in the Revolution.

F7AFAF96CEC74CF3A49CA72E13EAB044.description: Analyze the Declaration of Independence to determine the historical context and political philosophies that influenced its creation.

0A0580CDFD21433DAEC2CF402A6720D9.description: Trace the events leading to escalating conflict between Great Britain and the colonies, from multiple viewpoints.

BE1E4EE81A2448ACB5A5277EAB01E488.description: Compare and contrast the interaction of European settlers with Native Americans in both North and South America.

69CBDE23C76B4EC1BE7A78551780FD6A.description: Analyze the religious, cultural, and intellectual developments of the European colonies to explain the development of regionalism and an American identity.

55063230444C4B97AC16DBB0E53602DD.description: Analyze the religious, cultural, political and intellectual developments of Spanish, Portuguese, British and French regions to explain the development of diverse cultures throughout the Americas.

33651C9ED5E14BD9A09EEB3A3CB39DDC.description: Analyze the mercantile system to explain colonial responses to economic control by European nations including Great Britain.

D7B1ACA8BAC64894B72B2E5448341E5A.description: Compare sources of labor, emerging economic production, and availability of land in the New World and their impact on economic development in North and South America.

73C3CF80F0E343F29FD12B3548D3493A.description: Compare major patterns of population distribution, demographics and migrations in the United States and the impact of those patterns on cultures and community life.

055C664F8A944FAEAB5BB0088746D4B5.description: Analyze the geography of colonial regions in North and South America to explain their cultural, social and economic differences.

7851FA317C4E413898BBE73A22DF04F3.description: Analyze diverse Native American cultures in North, Central and South America to explain the ways they adapted to their various environments.

4CD6132CFD01484DAE5F0096FCD63CE8.description: Analyze local and colonial governments to trace the factors influencing their structure and function.

96B90C8C7D584E1299D647C3D8425EC2.description: Explain how the founding of European colonies influenced their governments and expectations for self-rule.

EE8B01CAF56C4EFEA33DAAC625F3DD1A.description: Compare the governmental systems of European powers to determine their effect on colonization in the Americas.

5CB0D894C54649F695D756762F6BC928.description: Analyze the concept of Manifest Destiny as a catalyst for change in American history.

5D72FBA7A3A84FC498EBA27B40952DA6.description: Describe the causes and consequences of the Seven Years War as a turning point in American history.

CFBE4C6B723D4E7997562635AC04C80C.description: Trace the causes and consequences of conflict and cooperation between Native Americans and North and South American colonists using multiple viewpoints.

A1CF50CA43484EA1A0349BE8DECA4C7D.description: Compare factors motivating Europeans to explore and settle in the New World to explain colonial diversity and regional differences in North and South America.

ED99B8348A7F4971A365F7F15A4EEF16.description: Trace the causes and consequences of indigenous. peoples arriving in the Americas beginning c. 15,000 BCE.

5429FFC6744B44F1B01B0154F794D1F1.description: Using an American history lens, examine the origins and impact of social structures and stratification on societies and relationships between peoples.

07B5ED0A0CF245FD8D7FB188F0D0A422.description: Using an American history lens, describe how peoples’ perspectives shaped the sources/artifacts they created.

1FE274A392664A1DB3ED3E6B28442F69.description: Using an American history lens, examine the opportunity costs and benefits of economic decisions on society as a whole as well as on individuals prior to c. 1870

AC9FA43667664F89A1E29015DFC34137.description: Locate major cities of Missouri, the United States, and the world; states of the United States and key world nations; the world’s continents, and oceans; and major topographical features of the United States.

E4803079EA984A67AE39328665BA873B.description: Explain how the physical and human characteristics of regions in the Americas prior to c.1870 are connected to changing identity and culture.

50D41712D5A34BAE95CE983B7C7082A8.description: Create and use maps and other graphic representations in order to explain relationships and reveal patterns or trends in United States’ history prior to c.1870.

7A0AA65F6E754493B273C307A94D3723.description: Analyze laws, policies, and processes to determine how governmental systems affect individuals and groups in society in United States history prior to c.1870.

2A4C3B0BE129496D90F68C14DC174734.description: Analyze the causes and consequences of a specific problem in United States history prior to c. 1870 as well as the challenges and opportunities faced by those trying to address the problem.

2B92293A8B03490093A73856D7712FA8.description: Using an inquiry lens, develop compelling questions about United States history prior to c. 1870 to determine helpful resources and consider multiple points of views represented in the resources.

33500716CCA943F48006D9C4CF749314.description: With assistance, develop a research plan, identify appropriate resources for investigating social studies topics, and create and present a research product which applies an aspect of United States history prior to c. 1870 to a contemporary issue.

AE2D2EE6322746DBA7046F73D6228A5E.description: Create and use tools to analyze a chronological sequence of related events in United States history.
